Uses of Package
framework

  • Packages that use framework 
    Package Description
    externalInformationPort
    ExternalInformationPort component - Used for (UDP-)Information (for example a public key) exchange with "external" communication partners (for example other mixes or clients).
    framework
    The package framework introduces all parts of the mix and the overall framework, which are not exchanged.
    gui
    The package gui helps the software engineer who wants to establish his own implementations of the components to set up a working configuration file.
    inputOutputHandler
    InputOutputHandler component - Handles (mix) message-based connections (see package Message) with communication partners (clients, other mixes and proxy servers) and therefore abstracts from the physical communication channels.
    keyGenerator
    KeyGenerator component - Used to generate cryptographic keys
    message
    Provides different message formats, the InputOutputHandler is capable of transmitting.
    messageProcessor
    MessageProcessor component - Takes messages from component InputOutputHandler, processes them (recoding, checking for replays, removing/adding padding, initiating message authentication) and bypasses them to component OutputStrategy.
    networkClock
    Network Clock component - Provides a clock, which could be synchronized with an SNTP server.
    outputStrategy
    Output Strategy component - Collects messages until an output criterion is fulfilled (certain number of messages collected or timeout reached)
    userDatabase
    User Database component - Used to store user-specific data (for example identifiers, session keys or buffers)
  • Classes in framework used by externalInformationPort 
    Class and Description
    ComponentReferences
    the interface ComponentReferences provides access to all the controllers, the logger and the settings class of a specific mix and to the mix itself
    Controller
    The abstract class Controller provides all methods, interfaces and fields that are needed by every controller.
    Implementation
    The abstract class Implementation implements the ComponentReferences interface, so that a particular implementation of a component knows about all Controllers of all other components of the mix.
    Mix
    This class coordinates the components of this mix.
  • Classes in framework used by framework 
    Class and Description
    ComponentReferences
    the interface ComponentReferences provides access to all the controllers, the logger and the settings class of a specific mix and to the mix itself
    Controller
    The abstract class Controller provides all methods, interfaces and fields that are needed by every controller.
    Implementation
    The abstract class Implementation implements the ComponentReferences interface, so that a particular implementation of a component knows about all Controllers of all other components of the mix.
    LocalClassLoader
    The LocalClassLoader extends the standard Java ClassLoader and is used to load the specific implementation classes into the framework and for testing purposes into the GUI.
    Mix
    This class coordinates the components of this mix.
    MixProperties
    Provides methods to load properties from a file and to convert property keys to different formats.
    Settings
    Provides properties from the file Properties.properties and provides methods to manipulate these properties.
  • Classes in framework used by gui

    MixProperties
    Provides methods to load properties from a file and to convert property keys to different formats.
